transcript:
another, look- ing from under his brows at the tipsy guests who were again crowding round the window, and listening to their chatter. Anatole kept on refilling Pierre's glass while explaining that D61okhov was betting with Stevens, an Eng- lish naval officer, that he would drink a bottle of rum sitting on the outer ledge of the third- floor window with his legs hanging out. 
"Go on, you must drink it all," said Anatole, giving Pierre the last glass, "or I won't let you go!" 
"No, I won't,"
